update.description:
fix issue #930. Interpolate range if vertical/horizontal resolution parameters are specified. 

This feature was previously only available in [gazebo_ros_pkgs' block laser](https://github.com/ros-simulation/gazebo_ros_pkgs/blob/hydro-devel/gazebo_plugins/src/gazebo_ros_block_laser.cpp). 

Functionality ported to gazebo. Added comments to explain the code, and unit and integration tests.

content.raw: yes i think this visualization should be useful for lasers with resolutions other than 1. Please file a ticket thanks!
content.html: yes i think this visualization should be useful for lasers with resolutions other than 1. Please file a ticket thanks!

content.raw:
I've made some minor editings. The code looks good to me. Just a general comment related with the use of <resolution>. If the number of samples is low compared with the laser field of view, the visualization might be confusing. Here is an example with 3 samples and a resolution value of 5.

![Laser visualization with 3 samples and resolution value of 5](http://gsyc.es/~caguero/laserAndResolution.png)

Should we improve the visualization by drawing the real ray sensors with a line slightly darker color? Something like this but probably with a thinner line.

![Laser visualization with 3 samples and resolution value of 5](http://gsyc.es/~caguero/laserAndResolution2.png)

I'll file a new ticket if you think it's a good idea.
content.html:
I've made some minor editings. The code looks good to me. Just a general comment related with the use of <resolution>. If the number of samples is low compared with the laser field of view, the visualization might be confusing. Here is an example with 3 samples and a resolution value of 5.

Should we improve the visualization by drawing the real ray sensors with a line slightly darker color? Something like this but probably with a thinner line.

I'll file a new ticket if you think it's a good idea.
